title: Cutoff details for last year through Jee Mains for admission in PES University.
content:
I tried to search online but couldn't find any legit or any proper details for cutoff through Jee Mains score for admission in PES. If someone can help me with the cutoff details for last year or provide any legitimate and official link to the site. It will be very helpful if someone can help me.

P.S.- My jee main percentile is 92. Is it possible to get any good branch or any branch.

comments.body:
>I tried to search online but couldn't find any legit or any proper details for cutoff through Jee Mains score for admission in PES

Did you try searching this subreddit? This was answered multiple times over the last 2 weeks and there are numerous posts about it.

>My jee main percentile is 92. Is it possible to get any good branch or any branch in PES University

Cutoff for CS is 98 percentile. Other branches will be lower than that.

They are not at all transparent about that. Not one bit. 

The only help i can give you is that I knew a guy in ec campus CSE who got ~98 percentile. I also know he applied kinda late so that might be a factor as well. 

You most likely will not get cs or ece with 92 percentile so don't get your hopes up. But apply nonetheless. Also just go write pessat, it's easier to get in and for the same fee
What about 96 percentile?

i know two people of rr campus('27 batch) one had 98.6%ile and other 97%ile, 98.6 one tho came through kcet so that's irrelevant but 97 one came through jee quota, so my guess is 97%ile would be the cutoff, but again i only know 1 person, idkkkk

Cs is still difficult. Ece is possible. Still though no harm in trying. 

But just go write pessat dude, you'll easily get cs. Why do you care lol it's the same fee anyways
I messed up my pessat lol
Bro you will still get a good rank chill. I got like 85 percentile in jee and got some 1500 rank in pessat. Not enough for cs in rr but good for everything else.
No dude you dint understand i attempted 90/180 absolutely no chance
Why though. Even attempting all questions randomly will result in a net positive marks right? And considering that someone like you will easily be able to eliminate one or two options per question
I was not feeling well . Thats why else i would have attempted more
Fine fine. Nothing you can do now. Just write the remaining as best as possible and hope you get lucky somewhere
Yeah... My main focus is now on comedk , the campus was nice especially the computer lab

Hey is comedk still taking applications? Asking for a friend. 

But yeah, write comedk very seriously. You can get really good colleges with minimal effort
Comedk application are closed , yeah i hope i can crack it man any tips?
I only got like 3k rank so not so much. But it's basically like kcet. Board exam level 1 mark questions is all they'll ask

Thanks for help .
I tried searching may I missed it 
Can you link the post please üôè

I thought of writing pessat but application forms are over but they are allowing to write the exam even after late registration but the cache is I can only get my exam centre at bangalore campus and I live in west Bengal.
Moreover the last date of exam is 12 May, so I guess it's not feasible.
Not sure if you‚Äôre aware, but there‚Äôs 0.25 negative marking that was introduced in Pessat from this year.

Of 4 random questions you should get 1 right and three wrong. This will net you a positive of 0.25 marks per 4 questions. You can use binomial to find the distribution if you want. 

Even randomly you're more likely to gain marks than to lose them

Now let's say that you're not a vegetable and you're able to eliminate one wrong option in every question. This way the odds are 1 in 3. Do binomial again and look at the distribution

I really want to agree to this, but using this logic in JEE Mains gave me a horrendous result in the first session.  

There‚Äôs no guarantee that I get 1 answer out of every 4 questions correct either, it‚Äôs not as simple as performing a binomial distribution to this because I‚Äôve left the toughest questions unanswered, knowing that the risk is too high.

Yes obviously there is no guarantee that you will get exactly 1 out of 4 correct. But as the number of questions increases the probability that the outcome will fit the distribution also increases. 

It is actually as simple as applying the binomial distribution lol. Probability doesn't lie. Do you not trust the math which you're currently learning.

Probability never lies, but when you take in the factor of the time remaining, and that I‚Äôve only left the toughest questions, the chances of me guessing the answer correctly gets thinner and thinner. 

I‚Äôm confident of the 104 questions that I‚Äôve attempted and I‚Äôm sure that guessing the remaining questions in the very little time I had would result in a majority of negative marks. This is indeed a high risk high reward game and I didn‚Äôt want to feel the ‚Äúthis is why you shouldn‚Äôt gamble, kids.‚Äù kind of vibe after my results come in. But let‚Äôs hope for the best.
Bro probability doesn't care how tough the question is lmao

You mentioned that it‚Äôs likely to be able to eliminate an option or two so it increases the probability of getting the answer right. And if the question itself is tough and I‚Äôm not able to eliminate any option, then of course the probability is dependent on the difficulty of the question.
Either way you're most likely to get a net positive mark. If you can eliminate, then you're more likely to get a net positive mark
I dint kcet , not from K.A tmrws the exam wish me luck.
Same logic applies for jee tho no?
Lmao good luck

Yeah. Its what have me atleast something. 

Literally in chem i didn't know a single question. In all entrance exams i basically guessed every chem question. Skipped the entire subject üòÇ
How much did this get you?

89 percentile i think. 

1.5 hours for math, 1.5 for phy. Last 5 minutes to guess chamüòÖ

I wish I was able to mug up something atleast
